background: The problem involves the optimization of duck transportation to shore after an oil spill, considering different capacities and time requirements for boats and canoes, along with limits on boat trips and a minimum percentage requirement for canoe trips.
constraints: Number of boats used is non-negative
Number of canoes used is non-negative
Ducks transported per boat is limited to DucksPerBoat
Ducks transported per canoe is limited to DucksPerCanoe
A maximum of MaxBoatTrips boat trips are allowed
At least MinCanoeTripsPercentage of the total trips must be by canoe
At least MinDucks ducks must be transported to shore
objective: Minimize the total time needed to transport all ducks to shore
description: There has been an oil spill in the ocean and ducks need to be taken to shore to be cleaned either by boat or by canoe. A boat can take \param{DucksPerBoat} ducks per trip while a canoe can take \param{DucksPerCanoe} ducks per trip. Since the boats are motor powered, they take \param{TimePerBoat} minutes per trip while the canoes take \param{TimePerCanoe} minutes per trip. In order to avoid further environmental damage, there can be at most \param{MaxBoatTrips} boat trips and at least \param{MinCanoeTripsPercentage} of the trips should be by canoe. If at least \param{MinDucks} ducks need to be taken to shore, how many of each transportation method should be used to minimize the total amount of time needed to transport the ducks?

parameters.definition: Number of ducks per boat trip
Number of ducks per canoe trip
Minimum percentage of trips that should be by canoe
Minimum number of ducks to be taken to shore
